page.title: 07Landscape description.
page.content: Used to be flat before Ice Age. Water and glaciers have cut valleys in southerly direction. Mainly deciduous woodland but much cut down for farming, building and smelting. Tops of mountain grassland, poor grazing. Housing in area mainly terraced but developments on estates at Penllwyn, The Bryn, Springfield, Grove Park, Cefn Fforest. Large number of people interviewed liked the area because of its proximity to shops and amenities, yet the area is still small enough to be 'friendly'. There is concern about vandalism and the amount of litter. It is a popular area as it is close to jobs and good roads like the M4 and the Heads of the Valleys Road.
